task.title: How to Use a Bullet Instead of Numbers for Tasks Containing a Single Step

context.p: If a DITA Task only contains one step (step element), you probably want it to be rendered like an unordered list (displayed with a bullet instead of a number).
Should be rendered as: o The stepInstead of: 1. The step

To achieve this, you need to create an XSLT template that adds a special outputclass attribute (with its value set to single) for the single step, then you need to match this attribute from the CSS and change its aspect.

info.codeblock: <xsl:template match="*[contains(@class, ' task/step ')][count(../*[contains (@class, ' task/step ')]) = 1]"> <xsl:copy> <xsl:copy-of select="@*"/> <xsl:attribute name="outputclass" select="concat(@outputclass, ' single ')"/> <xsl:apply-templates/> </xsl:copy> </xsl:template>
